question.text: In which of the following, R.Q will always be less than one?

options.text: More than one option is correct

solution.text: The ratio of the volume of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> evolved to the volume of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> consumed in respiration is called the respiratory quotient (RQ). When fats are used in respiration, the RQ is less than <math><mn>1</mn></math> . For oxidation of groundnut, fats are oxidized thus value of RQ is less than <math><mn>1</mn></math>. In  rice and potato the main respiratory substrate is carbohydrates, for which, the RQ value is one.
